intro: Halimolobos montanus, commonly known as the mountain halimolobos, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
